alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 05 at 8:12AM AKDT until July 06 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM AKDT THURSDAY FOR DELTANA AND TANANA FLATS... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 10 PM AKDT Thursday. * AFFECTED AREA...Deltana and Tanana Flats. * TIMING...From noon today to 10 PM AKDT Thursday. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 23 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid to upper 70s. * IMPACTS...Fires could spread rapidly Wednesday afternoon and continuing into Thursday. South winds will pick up on Wednesday afternoon and remain strong into Thursday. Temperatures will rise near 75 degrees on Wednesday and even warmer on Thursday with temperatures near 80 degrees. Low RH values expected today and Thursday. Moisture will increase on Friday and RH values expected to be above 30 percent on Friday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
